intro: Baphia borneensis, commonly known as the Bornean baphia, is a flowering plant species native to the rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Due to its habitat specificity, Baphia borneensis is considered a rare and endangered species, threatened by deforestation and habitat loss.
